curriculum.name: UK Medical Curriculum
curriculum.description: Comprehensive medical curriculum aligned with GMC outcomes for UK medical students

topics.label: Cardiovascular System
learning_objectives: Understand the structure and function of the cardiovascular system
Diagnose and manage common cardiovascular conditions
Interpret cardiovascular investigations appropriately
Recognize cardiovascular emergencies and initiate management

topics.label: Cardiac Anatomy
learning_objectives: Describe the anatomical structure of the heart including chambers, valves, and major vessels
Explain the coronary arterial blood supply and venous drainage
Understand the conducting system of the heart
Relate cardiac anatomy to surface landmarks for clinical examination

topics.label: Cardiac Physiology
learning_objectives: Explain the cardiac cycle and pressure-volume relationships
Understand cardiac output and its determinants
Describe the mechanisms of cardiac electrical conduction
Explain the Frank-Starling mechanism and cardiac contractility
Understand cardiac autoregulation and neural control

topics.label: ECG Interpretation
learning_objectives: Systematically interpret a 12-lead ECG
Recognize common ECG abnormalities including arrhythmias and ischaemia
Identify life-threatening ECG findings requiring urgent intervention
Correlate ECG findings with clinical presentations

topics.label: Heart Failure
learning_objectives: Define and classify heart failure (acute vs chronic, systolic vs diastolic)
Identify common causes and risk factors for heart failure
Recognize clinical features and investigate appropriately
Initiate and optimize medical management according to guidelines
Understand prognosis and when to refer for specialist input

topics.label: Arrhythmias
learning_objectives: Classify arrhythmias into bradycardias and tachycardias
Recognize atrial fibrillation and understand anticoagulation management
Identify and manage life-threatening arrhythmias (VT, VF)
Understand indications for cardioversion and pacing
Calculate CHA2DS2-VASc and HAS-BLED scores

topics.label: Ischaemic Heart Disease
learning_objectives: Understand the pathophysiology of atherosclerosis and coronary artery disease
Differentiate between stable angina, unstable angina, NSTEMI and STEMI
Calculate cardiovascular risk and implement primary prevention strategies
Manage acute coronary syndromes according to current guidelines
Recognize complications of MI and initiate appropriate management

topics.label: Valvular Heart Disease
learning_objectives: Describe the pathophysiology of common valvular lesions
Recognize clinical features of aortic stenosis, mitral regurgitation, and other valve diseases
Interpret murmurs on cardiovascular examination
Understand indications for valve repair or replacement
Recognize complications of prosthetic valves

topics.label: Hypertension
learning_objectives: Define hypertension and classify according to severity
Investigate to exclude secondary causes of hypertension
Understand end-organ damage and cardiovascular risk
Manage hypertension according to NICE guidelines
Recognize and manage hypertensive emergencies

topics.label: Respiratory System
learning_objectives: Understand the structure and function of the respiratory system
Diagnose and manage common respiratory conditions
Interpret respiratory investigations including chest X-rays and spirometry
Recognize respiratory emergencies and initiate appropriate management

topics.label: Respiratory Anatomy
learning_objectives: Describe the anatomical structure of the upper and lower respiratory tract
Understand the structure and function of the pleura
Explain the blood supply and innervation of the lungs
Relate respiratory anatomy to surface landmarks for examination

topics.label: Respiratory Physiology
learning_objectives: Explain the mechanics of breathing and gas exchange
Understand ventilation-perfusion matching
Describe oxygen and carbon dioxide transport
Interpret spirometry and other lung function tests
Understand control of respiration

topics.label: Asthma
learning_objectives: Understand the pathophysiology of asthma
Diagnose asthma using clinical features and investigations
Manage chronic asthma according to BTS/SIGN guidelines
Recognize and manage acute asthma exacerbations
Educate patients on inhaler technique and self-management

topics.label: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
learning_objectives: Understand the pathophysiology of COPD and emphysema
Diagnose COPD using spirometry and clinical assessment
Manage stable COPD including smoking cessation
Recognize and manage acute exacerbations of COPD
Understand indications for long-term oxygen therapy

topics.label: Pneumonia
learning_objectives: Classify pneumonia by setting and likely organisms
Recognize clinical features and investigate appropriately
Calculate CURB-65 score to guide management
Select appropriate antibiotic therapy
Identify complications of pneumonia

topics.label: Lung Cancer
learning_objectives: Classify lung cancers and understand staging systems
Recognize clinical presentations including paraneoplastic syndromes
Investigate suspected lung cancer appropriately
Understand management options including surgery, chemotherapy, and radiotherapy
Communicate sensitively about diagnosis and prognosis

topics.label: Pulmonary Embolism
learning_objectives: Understand risk factors for venous thromboembolism
Recognize clinical features of PE and calculate Wells score
Investigate appropriately using D-dimer and imaging
Manage acute PE including anticoagulation
Understand prophylaxis strategies

topics.label: Tuberculosis
learning_objectives: Understand the pathophysiology and epidemiology of TB
Recognize primary, latent, and reactivated TB
Investigate suspected TB including appropriate sampling
Manage TB with directly observed therapy
Understand public health implications and contact tracing

topics.label: Gastrointestinal System
learning_objectives: Understand the structure and function of the gastrointestinal system
Diagnose and manage common GI conditions
Interpret GI investigations appropriately
Recognize GI emergencies and initiate management

topics.label: Upper GI Bleeding
learning_objectives: Identify causes of upper GI bleeding including peptic ulcers and varices
Recognize clinical features and assess severity using Glasgow-Blatchford score
Resuscitate and stabilize patients with active bleeding
Understand indications for endoscopy
Manage variceal bleeding appropriately

topics.label: Inflammatory Bowel Disease
learning_objectives: Differentiate between Crohn's disease and ulcerative colitis
Recognize clinical features and extraintestinal manifestations
Investigate using appropriate blood tests, imaging, and endoscopy
Manage according to disease severity and location
Identify complications requiring surgical intervention

topics.label: Chronic Liver Disease
learning_objectives: Identify common causes of chronic liver disease
Recognize signs of chronic liver disease and portal hypertension
Understand Child-Pugh and MELD scoring systems
Manage complications including ascites, encephalopathy, and varices
Understand indications for liver transplantation

topics.label: Acute Abdomen
learning_objectives: Systematically assess patients with acute abdominal pain
Identify surgical emergencies requiring urgent referral
Recognize appendicitis, cholecystitis, bowel obstruction, and perforation
Investigate appropriately with imaging and laboratory tests
Provide initial management and resuscitation

topics.label: Colorectal Cancer
learning_objectives: Understand risk factors and screening programs for colorectal cancer
Recognize clinical presentations including red flag symptoms
Investigate using appropriate imaging and endoscopy
Understand staging and treatment options
Communicate sensitively about diagnosis and prognosis

topics.label: Coeliac Disease
learning_objectives: Understand the pathophysiology of coeliac disease
Recognize classical and atypical presentations
Investigate using serology and duodenal biopsy
Provide dietary advice and long-term management
Identify associated conditions and complications

topics.label: Pancreatitis
learning_objectives: Identify common causes of acute and chronic pancreatitis
Recognize clinical features and diagnostic criteria
Assess severity using Glasgow score
Manage acute pancreatitis including fluid resuscitation
Recognize complications including pseudocysts and necrosis

topics.label: Neurology
learning_objectives: Understand neurological anatomy and physiology
Perform systematic neurological examination
Diagnose and manage common neurological conditions
Recognize neurological emergencies

topics.label: Stroke
learning_objectives: Differentiate between ischaemic stroke, haemorrhagic stroke, and TIA
Recognize stroke syndromes and localize lesions
Assess using ROSIER and NIHSS scores
Manage acute stroke including thrombolysis criteria
Implement secondary prevention strategies

topics.label: Epilepsy
learning_objectives: Classify seizures and epilepsy syndromes
Diagnose epilepsy using clinical history and investigations
Manage epilepsy with antiepileptic medications
Recognize and manage status epilepticus
Counsel patients on driving and pregnancy

topics.label: Headache
learning_objectives: Classify primary and secondary headaches
Recognize red flags requiring urgent investigation
Diagnose tension headache, migraine, and cluster headache
Manage headaches appropriately including prophylaxis
Identify when imaging is indicated

topics.label: Parkinson's Disease
learning_objectives: Understand the pathophysiology of Parkinson's disease
Recognize cardinal features and differential diagnoses
Manage with dopaminergic medications
Identify motor and non-motor complications
Understand multidisciplinary management

topics.label: Multiple Sclerosis
learning_objectives: Understand the pathophysiology and classification of MS
Recognize common presentations including optic neuritis
Diagnose using McDonald criteria with MRI and CSF analysis
Manage relapses and disease-modifying treatments
Provide holistic and multidisciplinary care

topics.label: Meningitis and Encephalitis
learning_objectives: Differentiate between bacterial, viral, and other causes of meningitis
Recognize clinical features and perform lumbar puncture safely
Interpret CSF results
Manage bacterial meningitis with urgent antibiotics
Understand vaccination and prophylaxis

topics.label: Motor Neurone Disease
learning_objectives: Recognize upper and lower motor neurone signs
Diagnose MND and differentiate from mimics
Understand prognosis and disease progression
Provide palliative and multidisciplinary care
Discuss end-of-life decisions sensitively

topics.label: Renal Medicine
learning_objectives: Understand renal anatomy and physiology
Diagnose and manage common renal conditions
Interpret renal function tests and urinalysis
Recognize acute kidney injury and chronic kidney disease

topics.label: Acute Kidney Injury
learning_objectives: Define AKI using KDIGO criteria
Classify AKI into pre-renal, renal, and post-renal causes
Investigate and identify the underlying cause
Manage AKI including fluid balance and medication review
Recognize indications for renal replacement therapy

topics.label: Chronic Kidney Disease
learning_objectives: Classify CKD using eGFR and albuminuria
Identify causes and risk factors for CKD
Manage to slow progression and prevent complications
Recognize complications including anaemia and bone disease
Understand indications for dialysis and transplantation

topics.label: Glomerulonephritis
learning_objectives: Classify glomerulonephritis by presentation and histology
Recognize nephritic and nephrotic syndromes
Investigate with urinalysis, serology, and renal biopsy
Manage with immunosuppression where appropriate
Identify rapidly progressive glomerulonephritis

topics.label: Urinary Tract Infection
learning_objectives: Differentiate between lower and upper UTIs
Recognize risk factors and typical organisms
Investigate with urinalysis and culture
Prescribe appropriate antibiotics
Identify complications including urosepsis

topics.label: Electrolyte Disorders
learning_objectives: Understand normal electrolyte homeostasis
Recognize and investigate hyponatraemia and hypernatraemia
Manage hyperkalaemia as a medical emergency
Identify and treat hypocalcaemia and hypercalcaemia
Understand acid-base disorders

topics.label: Endocrine System
learning_objectives: Understand endocrine anatomy and hormone regulation
Diagnose and manage common endocrine conditions
Interpret hormone assays appropriately
Recognize endocrine emergencies

topics.label: Diabetes Mellitus
learning_objectives: Differentiate between type 1 and type 2 diabetes
Diagnose diabetes using appropriate criteria
Manage type 2 diabetes according to NICE guidelines
Recognize acute complications including DKA and HHS
Screen for and manage chronic complications

topics.label: Thyroid Disease
learning_objectives: Understand thyroid hormone regulation
Recognize hyperthyroidism and hypothyroidism
Investigate with thyroid function tests and imaging
Manage thyroid disorders medically and surgically
Recognize thyroid cancer and thyrotoxic crisis

topics.label: Adrenal Disorders
learning_objectives: Understand the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis
Recognize Cushing's syndrome and investigate causes
Diagnose and manage Addison's disease
Recognize and treat adrenal crisis as an emergency
Understand steroid replacement therapy

topics.label: Pituitary Disorders
learning_objectives: Understand pituitary hormone regulation
Recognize hypopituitarism and hormone deficiencies
Diagnose and manage acromegaly and prolactinoma
Investigate pituitary masses with imaging
Understand hormone replacement therapy

topics.label: Calcium and Bone Metabolism
learning_objectives: Understand calcium homeostasis and vitamin D metabolism
Diagnose and manage hypercalcaemia including malignancy
Recognize hypocalcaemia and its causes
Understand parathyroid disorders
Manage osteoporosis and fracture prevention

topics.label: Musculoskeletal System
learning_objectives: Understand musculoskeletal anatomy
Perform systematic joint examination
Diagnose and manage common rheumatological conditions
Interpret joint X-rays and inflammatory markers

topics.label: Rheumatoid Arthritis
learning_objectives: Understand the pathophysiology of RA
Recognize clinical features and extra-articular manifestations
Investigate with antibodies and imaging
Manage with DMARDs and biologics
Monitor for complications and drug side effects

topics.label: Osteoarthritis
learning_objectives: Understand the pathophysiology of osteoarthritis
Recognize clinical features and X-ray changes
Differentiate from inflammatory arthritis
Manage conservatively and with analgesia
Understand indications for joint replacement

topics.label: Gout and Crystal Arthropathy
learning_objectives: Understand uric acid metabolism and crystal formation
Recognize acute gout and pseudogout
Investigate with joint aspiration and microscopy
Manage acute attacks and provide prophylaxis
Counsel on lifestyle modifications

topics.label: Systemic Lupus Erythematosus
learning_objectives: Understand the pathophysiology of SLE
Recognize multisystem features and apply diagnostic criteria
Investigate with autoantibodies and complement levels
Manage with immunosuppression
Recognize complications including lupus nephritis

topics.label: Back Pain and Spinal Disorders
learning_objectives: Assess patients with back pain systematically
Identify red flags requiring urgent investigation
Recognize cauda equina syndrome
Differentiate mechanical from inflammatory back pain
Manage conservatively and refer appropriately

topics.label: Vasculitis
learning_objectives: Classify vasculitis by vessel size
Recognize presentations of common vasculitides
Investigate with ANCA and tissue biopsy
Manage with immunosuppression urgently
Recognize giant cell arteritis as an emergency

topics.label: Haematology
learning_objectives: Understand blood cell production and function
Diagnose and manage haematological conditions
Interpret full blood counts and blood films
Recognize haematological emergencies

topics.label: Anaemia
learning_objectives: Classify anaemia by MCV and underlying cause
Investigate with appropriate blood tests
Manage iron deficiency, B12, and folate deficiency
Recognize haemolytic anaemia
Understand when to transfuse

topics.label: Leukaemia
learning_objectives: Classify leukaemia as acute or chronic, myeloid or lymphoid
Recognize clinical presentations
Investigate with blood film and bone marrow
Understand treatment principles including chemotherapy
Recognize complications including tumour lysis syndrome

topics.label: Lymphoma
learning_objectives: Differentiate between Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphoma
Recognize B symptoms and lymphadenopathy
Investigate with imaging and lymph node biopsy
Understand staging systems
Explain treatment with chemotherapy and radiotherapy

topics.label: Coagulation Disorders
learning_objectives: Understand the coagulation cascade
Recognize inherited bleeding disorders including haemophilia
Investigate with coagulation screen
Manage anticoagulation and reversal
Recognize DIC and thrombotic thrombocytopenic purpura

topics.label: Infectious Diseases
learning_objectives: Understand microbiology and immunology principles
Diagnose and manage common infections
Prescribe antibiotics appropriately
Recognize sepsis and initiate management

topics.label: Sepsis and Septic Shock
learning_objectives: Recognize sepsis using clinical criteria
Understand the pathophysiology of septic shock
Implement the sepsis six bundle
Prescribe broad-spectrum antibiotics urgently
Provide critical care support

topics.label: HIV and AIDS
learning_objectives: Understand HIV transmission and pathophysiology
Recognize acute seroconversion and AIDS-defining illnesses
Investigate with HIV testing and CD4 counts
Manage with antiretroviral therapy
Understand prevention including PrEP and PEP

topics.label: Malaria and Travel Medicine
learning_objectives: Understand malaria transmission and life cycle
Recognize clinical features and complications
Investigate with blood films and rapid tests
Manage according to species and severity
Provide travel advice and prophylaxis

topics.label: Skin and Soft Tissue Infections
learning_objectives: Recognize cellulitis and differentiate from DVT
Diagnose necrotizing fasciitis as a surgical emergency
Manage with appropriate antibiotics
Recognize MRSA and understand infection control
Identify diabetic foot infections

topics.label: Viral Hepatitis
learning_objectives: Differentiate between hepatitis A, B, C, D, and E
Understand transmission routes and risk factors
Investigate with serology and viral loads
Manage chronic hepatitis B and C
Understand vaccination and prevention

topics.label: Clinical Pharmacology
learning_objectives: Understand pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics
Prescribe safely and effectively
Recognize and manage adverse drug reactions
Understand drug interactions

topics.label: Principles of Prescribing
learning_objectives: Write legal and legible prescriptions
Calculate drug doses appropriately
Understand pharmacokinetics in renal and hepatic impairment
Recognize high-risk medications requiring monitoring
Understand controlled drug regulations

topics.label: Adverse Drug Reactions
learning_objectives: Classify adverse drug reactions
Recognize common and serious ADRs
Report ADRs via yellow card scheme
Manage drug allergies and anaphylaxis
Understand drug interactions

topics.label: Analgesia and Pain Management
learning_objectives: Understand the WHO analgesic ladder
Prescribe opioids safely including dose conversions
Manage acute and chronic pain
Recognize opioid toxicity and reversal
Understand neuropathic pain management

topics.label: Antimicrobial Prescribing
learning_objectives: Understand antimicrobial mechanisms and resistance
Practice antimicrobial stewardship
Select appropriate empirical therapy
Recognize Clostridium difficile infection
Understand allergy and cross-reactivity

topics.label: Emergency Drugs
learning_objectives: Know the drugs used in cardiac arrest
Understand adrenaline dosing in anaphylaxis
Prescribe naloxone for opioid overdose
Manage benzodiazepine overdose with flumazenil
Understand emergency reversal agents

topics.label: Clinical Skills
learning_objectives: Perform systematic clinical examinations
Take comprehensive patient histories
Communicate effectively with patients and colleagues
Demonstrate practical procedures safely

topics.label: History Taking
learning_objectives: Take a systematic history using open and closed questions
Explore presenting complaints thoroughly
Conduct systems reviews
Take social, family, and drug histories
Summarize and present findings clearly

topics.label: Clinical Examination Skills
learning_objectives: Perform cardiovascular, respiratory, and abdominal examinations
Conduct neurological and musculoskeletal examinations
Examine cranial nerves systematically
Identify and interpret clinical signs
Present examination findings professionally

topics.label: Practical Procedures
learning_objectives: Perform venepuncture and cannulation safely
Take arterial blood gases and interpret results
Insert urinary catheters with aseptic technique
Demonstrate NG tube insertion
Understand consent and complications

topics.label: Communication Skills
learning_objectives: Build rapport and establish trust with patients
Break bad news sensitively using structured frameworks
Obtain informed consent
Communicate with multidisciplinary teams
Handle difficult conversations professionally
